title: "making medicine" monospaced font
content:
Can anyone ID this font - I’m coming up empty - it’s probably easy.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [making.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052352/http:/typophile.com/files/making.gif) | 4.63 KB |

 [‹ Viktoria und ihr Husar concert poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052352/http:/typophile.com/node/16549 "Go to previous forum topic") [hMMM? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052352/http:/typophile.com/node/16543 "Go to next forum topic")
author: evan

comments.content: Looks a bit [Ole Schäfer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052352/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ole%252BSch%2525C3%2525A4fer)ish, like a condensed version of [PTL Manual Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052352/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=OS.112028.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=making+medicine&sampleSize=32). Ole might be a good type technician, but he’s not a very good type designer IMNSHO... :^/
Why not search the TheSans family — some Monospaced variety, Luc[as} has probably done that too? (That m looks very dutch.)
It’s not monospaced the m is to wide.
